page.title: 05A Typical Day at School
page.content: The very first thing I do is go into the playground and wait for the whistle to go. The whistle goes and everyone goes into their classrooms. I always look on the blackboard to see what work we have to do. Then the classes go into the assembly. After assembly we sometimes do maths and mental arithmetic. After first play we do our project work for a little while. Then we go down and watch a television programme called "How We Used To Live." It is about a family called the Hodgkins who lived in Yorkshire in the 1920s. School ends at 3.20 p.m. After school there are clubs such as netball, soccer, rounders, chess, cricket, table tennis, needlework and country dancing. {Emma Smith aged 11 {
